WhitespaceMinimizedString.name: WhitespaceMinimizedString
WhitespaceMinimizedString.description: A string that has all whitespace trimmed off of beginning and end, and all internal whitespace segments reduced to single spaces. Whitespace includes #x9 (tab), #xA (linefeed), and #xD (carriage return).

float.name: float
float.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification

double.name: double
double.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification

decimal.name: decimal
decimal.description: A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification

time.name: time
time.description: A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners do not work with straight date or time

date.name: date
date.description: a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners don't work with straight date or time

datetime.name: datetime
datetime.description: The combination of a date and time

date_or_datetime.name: date_or_datetime
date_or_datetime.description: Either a date or a datetime

curie.name: curie
comments: in RDF serializations this MUST be expanded to a URI
in non-RDF serializations MAY be serialized as the compact representation

uri.name: uri
comments: in RDF serializations a slot with range of uri is treated as a literal or type xsd:anyURI unless it is an identifier or a reference to an identifier, in which case it is translated directly to a node

objectidentifier.name: objectidentifier
objectidentifier.description: A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model.
comments: Used for inheritence and type checking

nodeidentifier.name: nodeidentifier
nodeidentifier.description: A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model.

investigation_identifier.name: investigation_identifier
investigation_identifier.description: The identifier for this investigation collected using the investigation template. This is used to match the flow cytometry experiment to an investigation.
investigation_identifier.title: investigation_identifier

study_identifier.name: study_identifier
study_identifier.description: The identifier for this study collected using the template appropriate for your study design (e.g., MIATE for animal experiments). This is used to match the flow cytometry experiment to a study.
study_identifier.title: study_identifier

sample_identifier.name: sample_identifier
sample_identifier.description: The identifier for this study collected using the template appropriate for your study design (e.g., MIATE for animal experiments). This is used to match the sample source to the data.
sample_identifier.title: sample_identifier

metabolomic_experimet_dentifier.name: metabolomic_experimet_dentifier
metabolomic_experimet_dentifier.description: This is a unique ID assigned by the user to represent each individual record in this flow cytometry experiment.
metabolomic_experimet_dentifier.title: metabolomic_experimet_dentifier

purpose.name: purpose
purpose.description: A brief description of the goal of the experiment. This should include the rationale and hypothesis.
purpose.title: purpose
comments: TCDD is an environmental contaminant that elicits a number of hepatic effects including fat accumulation, inflammation, and fibrosis that can progress to hepatocellular carcinoma. RNA-Seq and targeted metabolomics were integrated with complementary dioxin response element (DRE) location and aryl hydrocarbon receptor (AhR) ChIP-Seq data to further investigate the hepatotoxicity of TCDD. Our integrative analysis identified changes similar to the Warburg effect observed in cancer cells, including pyruvate kinase isoform switching (PKM1 to PKM2), and an increase in the glutaminase (GLS1) GAC:KGA isoform ratio. Consequently, metabolites are redirected towards the pentose phosphate pathway, serine biosynthesis, and glutaminolysis. We propose that the effects of TCDD on central carbon and amino acid metabolism represents AhR-mediated hepatic metabolic reprogramming in order to increase NADPH production as an oxidative stress counter-measure.

primary_contact.name: primary_contact
primary_contact.description: The individual who is the primary contact for this experiment.
primary_contact.title: primary_contact

date.name: date
date.description: The date or time period during which the investigation was performed (i.e., from collecting and treating samples to performing data analysis) shall be stated.
date.title: date

extraction_protocol.name: extraction_protocol
extraction_protocol.description: A brief description of the flow cytometry protocol
extraction_protocol.title: extraction_protocol

extraction_protocol_DOI.name: extraction_protocol_DOI
extraction_protocol_DOI.description: A DOI to a version controlled protocol, preferably available on a repository such as protocols.io
extraction_protocol_DOI.title: extraction_protocol_DOI

extract_preservation_method.name: extract_preservation_method
extract_preservation_method.description: The chemical agent used for the derivatization reaction
extract_preservation_method.title: extract_preservation_method

calibration_standard.name: calibration_standard
calibration_standard.description: Indicate the name of the chemical compound used as calibration standard.
calibration_standard.title: calibration_standard

chromatography_protocol.name: chromatography_protocol
chromatography_protocol.description: A brief description of the flow cytometry protocol
chromatography_protocol.title: chromatography_protocol

chromatography_protocol_DOI.name: chromatography_protocol_DOI
chromatography_protocol_DOI.description: A DOI to a version controlled protocol, preferably available on a repository such as protocols.io
chromatography_protocol_DOI.title: chromatography_protocol_DOI

chromatography_column.name: chromatography_column
chromatography_column.description: The name of the chromatography column.
chromatography_column.title: chromatography_column

elution program.name: elution program
elution program.description: Description of the elution program using the following scheme
elution program.title: elution program
comments: Ramping from 90 % solvent A, 10 % solvent B to 100% solvant B in 30 min;100% solvent B, isocratic for 10 min

flow_rate.name: flow_rate
flow_rate.description: Report the flow rate of the elution buffer through column in amount per minute.
flow_rate.title: flow_rate

carrier_gas.name: carrier_gas
carrier_gas.description: The composition of the carrier gas (modile phase)
carrier_gas.title: carrier_gas

oven_temperature_program.name: oven_temperature_program
oven_temperature_program.description: The description of the gas chromatography oven temperature program
oven_temperature_program.title: oven_temperature_program
comments: 40 degree C hold for 1 min.;10 degree C/min. to 300 degree C;300 degree C hold for 10 min.

ms_protocol.name: ms_protocol
ms_protocol.description: A brief description of the flow cytometry protocol
ms_protocol.title: ms_protocol

ms_protocol_DOI.name: ms_protocol_DOI
ms_protocol_DOI.description: A DOI to a version controlled protocol, preferably available on a repository such as protocols.io
ms_protocol_DOI.title: ms_protocol_DOI

manufacturer.name: manufacturer
manufacturer.description: The name of the mass spectrometry instrument manufacturer
manufacturer.title: manufacturer

model.name: model
model.description: The name of the mass spectrometry instrument
model.title: model

scan_polarity.name: scan_polarity
scan_polarity.description: Relative orientation of the electromagnetic field during the selection and detection of ions in the mass spectrometer.
scan_polarity.title: scan_polarity

ionization_type.name: ionization_type
ionization_type.description: The method by which gas phase ions are generated from the sample.
ionization_type.title: ionization_type

detector_type.name: detector_type
detector_type.description: Type of detector used in the mass spectrometer.
detector_type.title: detector_type

mass_analyzer_type.name: mass_analyzer_type
mass_analyzer_type.description: Mass analyzer separates the ions according to their mass-to-charge ratio.
mass_analyzer_type.title: mass_analyzer_type

analysis_protocol.name: analysis_protocol
analysis_protocol.description: A brief description of the flow cytometry protocol
analysis_protocol.title: analysis_protocol

analysis_protocol_DOI.name: analysis_protocol_DOI
analysis_protocol_DOI.description: A DOI to a version controlled protocol, preferably available on a repository such as protocols.io
analysis_protocol_DOI.title: analysis_protocol_DOI

TransformationPurpose.name: TransformationPurpose
TransformationPurpose.description: The purpose of each performed transformation shall be specified (e.g., data visualization, background correction, statistical analysis, etc.).
TransformationPurpose.title: TransformationPurpose

TransformationDescription.name: TransformationDescription
TransformationDescription.description: Either the exact mathematical formulas/algorithms of each data transformation shall be supplied using an open and freely available specification, or a description of each transformation shall be provided.
TransformationDescription.title: TransformationDescription
